title: What are your counterarguments to the statement 'Donald Trump has narcissistic personality disorder'? - Quora

response.answer_text: This started as a comment, but it stands as my answer: Firstly, it’s not that he doesn’t meet certain criteria. It has more to do with the background and motivations behind the behavior, as well as their reliable repetition, rather than those behaviors themselves with regard to diagnosis. Also, there are dozens of disorders and mental illnesses that manifest traits that comorbidize with NPD or might outwardly, in passing, appear to be narcissistic— but all children are narcissistic, and almost all people with some kind of mental problem or drug addiction appear narcissistic. This does not make them narcissists or necessarily indicate NPD. Secondly, because of the statements above, it is completely irresponsible, totally unreasonable, and ultimately harmful for unqualified persons to go around diagnosing people. Only a qualified psychiatrist can acurately spot a person with narcissistic personality disorder— and it takes months of analysis and ruling out of other disorders. Quorans like to puff their chests and pontificate as if they know more about NPD than real doctors or the NPD’s themselves; it’s just not so. If you don’t like the behaviors, concentrate on that. Leave the diagnoses to professionals. Only Trump’s doctors can really tell if he has NPD; anyone else is just speculating/talking out of their asses. If Trump really is an NPD, he’s a rather low-functioning, unaware, and stupid one; it’s fair to say that most of us don’t agree he’s qualified IN ANY WAY to be counted among us. Stop diagnosing ANYONE unless you’re the psychiatrist who has treated that particular person. Doing so is irresponsible, unethical, and almost always incorrect.
